results.title: Antamosi
results.creator_credit: Ana Kokkinos and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Memories, betrayals and secrets emerge from the past when Katina’s mother comes from Greece to visit the family. As the truth about the family’s war-time involvement is revealed, the bitter embrace between mother and daughter is observed by Katina’s own daughter Sophia who must play her own role in this moving drama of estrangement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ana Kokkinos and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Anoop and the elephant
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Hugh Stewart, Anvil Films and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Engaging and highly entertaining children’s adventure story set in the world of the circus. Anoop, an Indian boy, and his friends attempt to rescue a performing elephant (Riley) from a life in the circus. Cast includes Jimmy Edwards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Eady, Hugh Stewart, Anvil Films and Children’s Film Foundation

results.title: Annie's Coming Out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A warm, moving film experience and a triumph of the human spirit. “Annie’s Coming Out” is based on the true story of Annie McDonald. Jessica Hathaway (Angela Punch McGregor) works at a hospital for handicapped children, and among her charges is Annie, a victim of cerebral palsy. Discovering Annie’s considerable intelligence, Jessica endeavours to prove this and must take her case to court in a battle against the establishment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Anna Who?
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel and South Australian College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: A film which dispels the myth that Anorexia Nervosa is a slimmers disease affecting only figure conscious women. Five young people (four women and one man) talk frankly about their experience of Anorexia and Bulimia, the factors in the cause and progress of the disease, and the road to recovery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pip Karmel and South Australian College of Advanced Education

results.title: Anna [Italian version]
results.brief_description: Anna is the story of a young mother and her mentally handicapped son, Tom. The film traces the path followed by Anna in overcoming her distrust of professional health workers and outsiders. We follow Anna as she searches with increasing confidence, for the extra help that she is told is available to herself and young son Tom.
results.description: Anna is the story of a young mother and her mentally handicapped son, Tom.
